result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Winkler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: undecided

Defendant David J Winkler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:49 AM. State - resolved - g/nc to count #1 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, joint of 6 months probation with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or alcohol or drugs unless specifically prescribed to him and take only meds as prescribed to him, court costs. Burns and Winkler agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #4. Burns pleads NC to count #1 as alleged. Winkler agrees. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and right to JT by entering his plea, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Winkler makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, all other conditions left up to P&P agent, court costs - paid thru probation, 1 day credit only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant David J Winkler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:11 PM. Burns has Information, mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 8/25/15 at 11:45 AM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt: JP
Arraignment at 04-22-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant David J Winkler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:21 PM. State calls James Polar. Polar sworn in at 2:21 PM. Court goes thru collaquey with the witness regarding his testimony today and being advised off the record by his attorney whether to testify or not. Polar willing to testify. Direct exam by State at 2:22 PM. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Burns at 2:27 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (2:29 PM).  State objects - sustained (2:29 PM). Polar excused at 2:29 PM. State calls Officer Eric Bath. Bath sworn in at 2:30 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns at 2:35 PM. State objects - speculation - sustained (2:36 PM). Bath excused. Burns makes argument prior to ruling - discussion on count #2. State responds, asks court to find that some felony was committed. Burns responds. Discussion held. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State does not have Information. Court continues bond, sets for ARGN.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant David J Winkler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:49 AM. State - did not appear on a PH. Burns responds. Winkler explains why he was not here on 3/18/15. Burns asks Court to quash the warrant for stated reasons and asks for the Court to reinstate the signature bond. State responds. State - bond - $500 cash. Burns - bond - reinstate signature bond. Court - bond - will resinstate signature bond but warns about not appearing for Court again in the future. Court quashes the warrant and sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Burns not aware of the defendant's whereabouts but did receive a message from the defendant on her phone asking for a delayed for stated reasons. State - asks for bench warrant, body or $1500.00. Burns has nothing to add. Court issues bench warrant, body or $1000.00.
